pkgmetadata.longdescription: The ccontrol program takes over the roles of the compiler, linker and make, and reads a configuration file to decide what to do before invoking them. This is particularly useful for centralized control over commands and options, such as enabling sys-devel/distcc and dev-util/ccache. It is also great for controlling parallelism and which compiler versions to use, based on the directory and make targets.
